episodes.title: Inside today's grooming gangs: Scarlett tells Sky News her story
episodes.description:
Twenty-year-old survivor, Scarlett West, explores how grooming gangs operate in the UK today, meeting other girls who have recently escaped and a 15-year-old who is still trapped in exploitation. 

The film reveals how these networks have evolved, and uncovers new tactics, and surprising revelations about who the groomers really are.

WARNING: This programme contains strong language and distressing images and descriptions of grooming, sexual abuse of children and self-harm.

Anyone feeling emotionally distressed or suicidal can call Samaritans for help on 116 123 or email jo@samaritans.org in the UK.

episodes.title: Royal Contrast: William’s COP30 push overshadowed by Andrew’s US Congress summons
episodes.description:
Prince William has addressed world leaders in Brazil ahead of the COP30 summit. 

The future King called for courage and co-operation to tackle the climate crisis. "If we wait for good leaders, we're going to be waiting a very long time" says Prince William. 

But in the background, his uncle Andrew Mountbatten Windsor was asked to appear before the US Congress to answer questions about the paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein.

episodes.title: US Congress summon Andrew Mountbatten Windsor to explain Epstein links
episodes.description:
The US Congress has written to Andrew Mountbatten Windsor requesting an interview with him in connection with his "long-standing friendship" with paedophile financier Jeffrey Epstein.

The Committee on Oversight and Government Reform said it is investigating the late financier's "sex trafficking operations".

episodes.title: Will Andrew Mountbatten Windsor be welcome in Sandringham? Sky News asks the locals
episodes.description:
Sky's Oliver Whitfield-Miocic reports from Sandringham following the announcement from Buckingham Palace: the King had served notice for Andrew to surrender his lease on Royal Lodge.

The former prince will move to a property on the Sandringham estate.

One resident said, "his reputation now is tarnished and I don't think its right - I don't think people local really want to see him here."

episodes.title: Government supports King's decision to strip Andrew of titles and kick him out of Royal Lodge
episodes.description:
Government minister Sir Chris Bryant is asked to comment on the King's decision to remove Prince Andrew's royal titles and have him leave his Windsor home after weeks of renewed scrutiny over his relationship with paedophile Jeffrey Epstein.

The minister told our presenter Anna Jones: "We do support what the King has done, and we've taken our lead from the palace.

"I think lots of voters up and down the country will think that this is the right thing to do at this stage."

Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/politics-latest-reeves-rent-mistake-labour-starmer-asylum-budget-tax-farage-reform-12593360

episodes.description:
Andrew Lownie, the Author of 'The Rise and Fall of the House of York' has told Sky News that Andrew losing his titles is "a welcome step".

The King has initiated the "formal process" to remove Prince Andrew's titles and honours – and notice has been served for Andrew to surrender his lease at the Royal Lodge, Buckingham Palace said in a statement.

episodes.title: Family of Virginia Giuffre say she 'brought down a British prince'
episodes.description:
The family of Andrew's main accuser, Virginia Giuffre, have said in a statement that she "brought down a British prince with her truth and extraordinary courage".

Giuffre, who took her own life in April, alleged she had sex with Andrew on three separate occasions when she was a teenager - something Andrew has repeatedly denied.

episodes.title: Breakfast | Face to face with 'cult' in Scottish woods
'African tribe' members evicted after raid on Scottish wood | Sky News coverage
episodes.description:
Members of a self-styled African tribe living in a Scottish forest have been evicted, Sky News has been told.

The group, who have named themselves the Kingdom of Kubala, have been living in woods in Jedburgh, near the border of England, since May.

After they were served with an eviction notice in August as they were on private land, the trio moved their campsite over a fence to a neighbouring plot of land owned by the council.

At Selkirk Sheriff Court on Wednesday, Sheriff Peter Paterson ruled that the trio would not be able to return to the original plot of land they were evicted from.

The group is made up of Kofi Offeh, 36, who calls himself King Atehene, his wife Jean Gasho, 43, who calls herself Queen Nandi, and "handmaiden" Kaura Taylor, 21, who goes by the name of Asnat.

You can read more on this story on the Sky News website:  https://news.sky.com/story/mother-calls-for-brainwashed-daughter-living-with-cult-in-scottish-wood-to-be-deported-back-to-texas-13442259

episodes.title: Sky News confronts 'African tribe' branded a 'cult' in Scottish woods
episodes.description:
There are claims a self-proclaimed African tribe living in Scottish woodlands are a 'cult' who have brainwashed a young woman from America to join their group. 

Kaura Taylor's family reported her missing from Dallas, Texas, two years ago before footage appeared of her online apparently being "bought" by members of the Kingdom of Kubala in the town of Jedburgh in the Scottish borders.

Now, her mother has given an exclusive interview to Sky News. 

Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/the-kingdom-of-kubala-is-more-farce-than-fiction-13436726

It follows a Sky News investigation into allegations about the Red House home in Norfolk.

Sixty people now say they were abused at the institution, which was run by a group that some have described as a "cult".

episodes.title: Actor and comedian Russell Brand charged with rape and sexual assault
episodes.description:
Russell Brand has been charged with rape and two counts of sexual assault between 1999 and 2005.

The Metropolitan Police say the comedian, 50, has also been charged with one count of oral rape and one count of indecent assault.

Police have said Brand is accused of raping a woman in the Bournemouth area in 1999 and indecently assaulting a woman in the Westminster area of London in 2001.

episodes.description:
The UK Tonight with Sarah-Jane Mee will dig into the issues people across the country are talking about and explain and analyse the news stories they need to know in a dynamic hour of domestic news. 
 
Tonight,

🔴 More than 40 people who were sent to The Red House, a now defunct children’s home in remote Norfolk, say they were physically, sexually and psychologically abused there

🔴 Newly obtained video footage reveals the moment container ship Solong crashed into US oil tanker Stena Immaculate off the coast of East Yorkshire on Monday morning.

🔴 The Hertfordshire village hounded by a Harris Hawk. We'll speak to one of a number of residents who have attacked by a vicious bird of prey in the last 2 weeks

episodes.title: The Danish group behind a children's home run like a cult
episodes.description:
The Red House was a children’s home in Norfolk which took in hundreds of students in care from across the UK between 1984 and 1998.   

It was run by a controversial Danish group called Tvind, operating an unconventional education system - most students from the Red House left without any qualifications. Now, over 40 former pupils have come forward with allegations of physical and sexual abuse they say they faced at the home.   

On the Sky News Daily, Niall Paterson speaks to correspondent Alice Porter about what has been uncovered, as she travelled to Denmark to track down the organisation behind the Red House and investigate claims it is a cult. And we hear from victims about the alleged abuse faced by students. 
 
Producer: Soila Apparicio 
Editor: Philly Beaumont

episodes.title: Sky News Investigates: The children's home run by a cult-like group of teachers
episodes.description:
A warning this report contains references to sexual assault and suicide

More than 40 people who were sent to The Red House, a now defunct children’s home in remote Norfolk, say they were physically, sexually and psychologically abused there.

Former students report a toxic culture of public shaming, with staff acting as violent ringleaders. 

Sky's Alice Porter travelled to Denmark to find out more about the radical Danish group which ran the school.

Anyone feeling emotionally distressed or suicidal can call Samaritans for help on 116 123 or email jo@samaritans.org in the UK. In the US, call the Samaritans branch in your area or 1 (800) 273-TALK

episodes.title: Neo-Nazi satanist jailed for encouraging suicide online and possessing terror material
episodes.description:
A teenage Neo-Nazi satanist who was caught with terrorism material and encouraged suicide online has been jailed for six years.

Cameron Finnigan, 19, from West Sussex, joined a satanic extremist group in late 2023 and told one girl to kill herself "for me" on video so he could share it in the group's online chat, the Old Bailey heard.

He also admitted to having indecent images of a child and two counts of criminal damage.

Anyone feeling emotionally distressed or suicidal can call Samaritans for help on 116 123 or email jo@samaritans.org in the UK. In the US, call the Samaritans branch in your area or 1 (800) 273-TALK.

Read more: https://news.sky.com/story/neo-nazi-satanist-cameron-finnigan-jailed-for-encouraging-suicide-online-and-possessing-terror-material-13289400

episodes.title: Teenager sentenced at the Old Bailey for possessing terror material - Watch in full
episodes.description:
A teenage Neo-Nazi satanist who was caught with terrorism material and encouraged suicide online has been jailed for six years.

Cameron Finnigan, 19, from Horsham, West Sussex, joined a satanic extremist group in late 2023 and told one girl to kill herself "for me" on video so he could share it in the group's online chat, the Old Bailey heard.

Anyone feeling emotionally distressed or suicidal can call Samaritans for help on 116 123 or email jo@samaritans.org in the UK. In the US, call the Samaritans branch in your area or 1 (800) 273-TALK.

Get the latest on the Sky News website: https://news.sky.com/

episodes.title: Cult members sentenced for plotting to abduct a coroner in Essex
episodes.description:
Four members of a group who plotted to kidnap a coroner have been jailed.

Mark Christopher, 59 and Matthew Martin, 47, both from east London, along with married couple Shiza Harper, 45, and Sean Harper, 38, both from South Benfleet, Essex were convicted of conspiracy to kidnap and conspiracy to commit false imprisonment in July

Read more on this story: https://news.sky.com/story/cult-members-who-wanted-to-construct-own-legal-system-jailed-for-coroner-kidnap-plot-13241163

episodes.title: Daughter of Aravindan Balakrishnan: "He Was A Psychopath"
episodes.description:
"He was a psycopath". In a Sky News special report, Katy Morgan-Davies, who spent three decades as the captive of her father and cult leader Aravindan Balakrishnan's, has described him as a narcissist who loves violence.
